verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, See, I have made thee a god to Pharaoh: and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
Thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he send the children of Israel out of his land.
And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
But Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that I may lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth mine armies, \add and\add* my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
And the Egyptians shall know that I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, when I stretch forth mine hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
And Moses and Aaron did as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded them, so did they.
And Moses \add was\add* fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spake unto Pharaoh.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, Shew a miracle for you: then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast \add it\add* before Pharaoh, \add and\add* it shall become a serpent.
And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so as the \sc Lord\sc* had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh, and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
Then Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers: now the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
And he hardened Pharaoh’s heart, that he hearkened not unto them; as the \sc Lord\sc* had said.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart \add is\add* hardened, he refuseth to let the people go.

Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river’s brink against he come; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand.

And thou shalt say unto him, The \sc Lord\sc* God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, In this thou shalt know that I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*: behold, I will smite with the rod that \add is\add* in mine hand upon the waters which \add are\add* in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
And the fish that \add is\add* in the river shall die, and the river shall stink; and the Egyptians shall lothe to drink of the water of the river.

And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thine hand upon the waters of Egypt, upon their streams, upon their rivers, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pools of water, that they may become blood; and \add that\add* there may be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in \add vessels of\add* wood, and in \add vessels of\add* stone.

And Moses and Aaron did so, as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded; and he lift up the rod, and smote the waters that \add were\add* in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that \add were\add* in the river were turned to blood.
And the fish that \add was\add* in the river died; and the river stunk, and the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river; and there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
And the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, neither did he hearken unto them; as the Lord had said.
And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he set his heart to this also.
And all the Egyptians digged round about the river \add for\add* water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
And seven days were fulfilled, after \add that\add* the \sc Lord\sc* had smitten the river.
